intro: Phacelia secunda var. pinnata, commonly known as the slender phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers and finely divided, pinnate leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a low-growing habit with slender stems and is often found in disturbed soils. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
